intro: Zygophyllum rosowii var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf zygophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically broad and oval in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, which bloom during the warmer months. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. This species is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
